title: Trash talking is ruining this community and slowly making it a toxic wreck
body:
[This is a repost of one of my replies, but I thought I needed to get it out to the wider community. Trash talking is not ok, and this idea that it's harmless fun needs to stop.]

I'm not exactly a lawyer, but I'm pretty sure encouraging someone to commit suicide, or carry out a crime is a crime in itself. 

By the same rite, trying to test the mental limits of the players you are against is more than just a dick move. It's indirectly ruining the games of thousands of more players, including the one you are playing against, and is part of the reason this community is so toxic.

By intentionally tilting a player, you put them in a bad mood for that game, and every single one they play after it that day and maybe even the next. Now that they are in a bad mood, they are more likely to tilt the next game if they already haven't, putting other players they are playing with on tilt. On top of this, putting a player on tilt causes them to play worse for all of these games, making them much harder to win for the players who aren't.   This even further contributes to their tilt.

Now these 4, or even 9 other players will go into their next games on tilt, with the same attitude. And the cycle continues.

People blame toxicity on game length, or autofill, or the report system, but if we want to fix toxicity we have to start with one of the fundamental problems in this game.  

Creating a community that is ok with, or even encourages trash talk that is "harmless" ruins the games of millions of players every year, and is one of the reasons this game has such a bad reputation.

Now here's my story:

I'm considered a toxic player by the system. I've had a chat restriction, but I'm looking to reform. I've noticed that leading up to my chat restriction, I had progressively grown more and more toxic without even realizing it. It isn't until now that I realize all the trash talk over the years eventually built up and I couldn't take it anymore. I am living proof that this is a problem. While I'm not going to blame some of the things I've said on the playerbase, I hope for change in the near future, or we will be all worse for it as a community. Thanks.

replies.body: I don't think trash talking is making the game awful, i think it's the people who harass others and then call it trash talk are making the game awful. I trash talk in games every now and then but it's always done playfully, like if I steal a baron, I say "ty for baron"
Or when the enemy accidentally uses flash and you ask them "you scared?" :P

I think you're lumping all types of bad and harassing chat into trash talk. "GG EZ" "LOL YOU DIED" aren't exactly trash talk.

It's a good conversation we should be having over what is and isn't trash talk, but previous threads have been derailed with 1-sided views that really hadn't defined what's acceptable trash talk and what crosses that line.

So let's start from a very basic level: have you ever had a positive interaction with an enemy, and if so, what'd ya'll talk about?

I can honestly tell you I haven't had a single game where I've had "friendly trash talk" between someone on the enemy team. It's just not something that's realistic when you dont even know any other player in the game in real life.

> [{quoted}](name=WrÆth,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gapnR1cZ,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-02-06T21:52:26.515+0000)
>
> I can honestly tell you I haven't had a single game where I've had "friendly trash talk" between someone on the enemy team. It's just not something that's realistic when you dont even know any other player in the game in real life.

I engage in friendly small talk and or funny role play in all chat. Like in one game I recall with the funny role play, this enemy Nasus was on me like all the freaking time so I said, "Nasus, I know you like chewing on my stuffed bear Tibbers, but there are other people on my team who would like some of your love and attention, go play with them."

Usually when I engage in friendly banter like this, the enemy team responds positively and follows up with some other kind of role played response. He responded with something like "but Tibbers has a squeaker in it!"
Yeah, this is fine, but this isn't realistic or what happens. Most of the time it's "ggez" "you dead" "trash" "garbage" spam.

> [{quoted}](name=WrÆth,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gapnR1cZ,comment-id=0002000000010001,timestamp=2018-02-08T23:42:00.793+0000)
>
> Yeah, this is fine, but this isn't realistic or what happens. Most of the time it's "ggez" "you dead" "trash" "garbage" spam.

Well, maybe one day we'll be matched against or with each other and you'll see that I actually do say things like this to enemy players.

I have had some players initiate the funny role play but I do agree that it doesn't happen often.

But I would say that those who spam ggez/you dead are toxic not because of trash talking, but because they're taking that extra step of taking their trash talk and turning it toxic by spamming it. Calling someone trash/garbage itself I think is toxic and I wouldn't call it trash talk... even though they are actually talking... and saying "trash".... you know what I mean lol
I think "role play" plays a big part in what's funny and entertaining chat between enemy players.

I guess I feel like there are some forms of trash talk that are acceptable, but they should at the very least be fun and entertaining to both parties involved, which is why I think talking "in character" is probably one of the few universal things I think that could be considered good trash talk. If you do cross the line, and I'd imagine this could happen, then clearly you'd stop. 

Chermorg mentioned making fun of someone's fail flash with a /all "You scared?" but if they don't respond well with that, then I don't think I'd follow up with any more chat with that player, as they're just not having a fun time.
Never had *any* friendly talk between you and your opponent?

>Trash talking is not ok, and this idea that it's harmless fun needs to stop.

Wow, who would have thought that playing a competitive game would result in the winner boasting. 
By this logic, every game should end in a tie so no one gets their feelings hurt.

actually they have started doing that in some sports. Sure its like "little league" sports. But they stopped keeping track of scores so no one gets their feelings hurt by being the "losing" team. 

Just look up "No-score youth sports"

The kids keep track of the scores while the parents try and coddle and bubble-wrap their kids to protect their feelings.
